medical_history.chief_complaint: Hypoxemia leading to diagnosis of Hepatopulmonary Syndrome (HPS) in a patient with HIV and chronic liver disease due to Hepatitis C.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: New-onset symptoms of easy fatigability and shortness of breath gradually progressed over a 2-month interval, with low exercise tolerance limited to walking 2 blocks. Required frequent naps and multiple rest periods to complete daily activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV infection diagnosed in 1983, chronic infection with Hepatitis C (HCV) diagnosed in 1995, splenectomy in 1989 following abdominal gunshot wound, and a history of cigarette smoking (25 pack-years).
medical_history.social_history: Long-term methadone therapy; he had discontinued smoking.
